sen.j: 山城町（やましろちょう）は、京都府の南部にあった町。
sen.e: Yamashiro-cho Town once existed in the sothern part of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 2007年3月12日に木津町・加茂町 (京都府)と合併し、木津川市となった。
sen.e: On March 12, 2007, this town mwerged with Kizu-cho Twon and Kamo-cho Town (both located in Kyoto Prefecture) to become Kizugawa City.
On March 12, 2007, this town mwerged with Kizu-cho Twon and Kamo-cho Town (both located in Kyoto Prefecture) to become Kizugawa City.
On March 12, 2007, this town merged with Kizu-cho and Kamo-cho (Kyoto Prefecture) to become Kizugawa City.

sen.j: タケノコ（たけのこ）、お茶が特産。
sen.e: It specialities are bamboo shoots and tea.
It specialities are bamboo shoots and tea.
Its specialties are bamboo shoots and tea.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）4月1日 町村制施行により椿井村・北河原村・神童寺村が合併し、高麗村。
sen.e: April 1, 1889: Corresponding to the enforcement of the town-vilage system, Tsubai-mura Village, Kita-Kawara-mura Village (北河原村) and Shindoji-mura Village (神童寺村) merged into Korai-mura Village.
April 1, 1889:Tsubai-mura Village, Kita-Kawara-mura Village (北河原村) and Shindoji-mura Village (神童寺村) merged into Korai-mura Village corresponding to the enforcement of the town-vilage system.
April 1, 1889: The Villages of Tsubai-mura, Kita-Kawara-mura (北河原村) and Shindoji-mura (神童寺村) merged to form Korai-mura corresponding to the enforcement of the town-village system.
sen.cmt: village を削除しました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 綺田村・平尾村が合併し、棚倉村。
sen.e: Kabata-mura Village and Hirao-mura Village (平尾村) merged into Tanakura-mura Village.
Kabata-mura Village and Hirao-mura Village (平尾村) merged into Tanakura-mura Village.
The villages of Kabata-mura and Hirao-mura (平尾村) merged into Tanakura-mura.
The three villages, including Kamikoma-mura Village, were inaugurated.
The three villages, including Kamikoma-mura Village, were inaugurated.
The three villages, including Kamikoma-mura, were inaugurated.

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）7月1日 上狛村が町制施行して上狛町となる。
sen.e: July 1, 1926: Kamikoma-mura Village acquired the town status, becoming Kamikoma-cho Town.
July 1, 1926: Kamikoma-mura Village acquired the town status, becoming Kamikoma-cho Town.
July 1, 1926: Kamikoma-mura acquired the town status, becoming Kamikoma-cho.

sen.j: 1956年（昭和31年）8月1日 上狛町、高麗村、棚倉村の1町2村が合併して、山城町が発足。
sen.e: August 1, 1956: Kamikoma-cho Town, Korai-mura Village and Tanakura-mura Village merged to inaugurate Yamashito-cho Town
August 1, 1956: Kamikoma-cho Town, Korai-mura Village and Tanakura-mura Village merged to inaugurate Yamashito-cho Town
August 1, 1956: Kamikoma-cho, Korai-mura and Tanakura-mura merged to inaugurate Yamashiro-cho.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）3月12日 木津町・加茂町 (京都府)と合併し木津川市となった。
sen.e: March, 12, 2007: Yamashiro-cho Town, Kizu-cho Town and Kamo-cho Town (located in Kyoto Prefecture) merged inot Tozuwagawa City.
March, 12, 2007: Yamashiro-cho Town, Kizu-cho Town and Kamo-cho Town (located in Kyoto Prefecture) merged inot Tozuwagawa City.
March, 12, 2007: Yamashiro-cho, Kizu-cho and Kamo-cho (Kyoto Prefecture) merged into Kizugawa City.
